alert.note: Alert for Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 2:55PM EST until December 23 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected; wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation; additional snow accumulations of less than one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected; total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches; winds gusting as high as 65 mph; visibility below a half mile at times. * WHERE...Western Pendleton County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Friday to 1 PM EST Saturday. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM EST this afternoon. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 6 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes, as well as holiday travel. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines, resulting in numerous power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Warning, the highest wind speeds will be Friday into Friday evening. Near blizzard conditions are possible. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
